cyclone.name: ARTHUR
cyclone.current_location: about 210 miles SSW of Cape Hatteras, North Carolina
cyclone.trajectory: Moving north-northeast, forecast to skirt the North Carolina Outer Banks Monday, then accelerate northeast and turn east away from the mid-Atlantic coast
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: near or just east of Cape Hatteras, NC (brush rather than a direct landfall)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Surf City to Duck NC, including Pamlico and Albemarle Sounds
weather_observation.warning_coast: Surf City to Duck NC, including Pamlico and Albemarle Sounds (Tropical Storm Warning)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Southeast U.S. through mid-Atlantic coastline from Georgia to New Jersey with rough surf and rip currents
weather_observation.wind: Gusty east to northeast winds 25–35 mph possible early Tuesday as Arthur passes offshore
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor tidal enhancement and dangerous rip currents possible, but surge heights below 3 ft
weather_observation.rainfall: 1–2 inches of rain possible Tuesday with locally higher amounts in bands
weather_observation.other_hazards: High surf and rip currents could disrupt vessel movements and port approaches
